name: palmate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
shaped like the fingers of an open hand: The enormous, palmate antlers of stags can span 42 inches.
used to describe a type of compound leaf with small leaves that all grow from the same point at the end of the stem, like the fingers of an open hand: It is an evergreen shrub with dark green, glossy, palmate leaves. It grows about 6 inches high, with palmated or five-lobed hairy leaves. Compare
pinnateRelated word
palmately
If a bird has palmate feet, its front toes are connected by skin: In palmate feet, digit 1 is backwards and digits 2, 3, and 4 are connected by webbing. Synonym
webbed (BODY)Compare
semipalmated
More examplesFewer examplesThe moose often stands seven feet high with its immense palmated antlers.The leaves are palmate and glossy green.The black and white, or palmated, goose is now extinct there.
